Account.description: An Account represents an account with an insurance carrier and includes high-level account information (e.g. name) and any Policy objects associated with the Account.
Account.name: Account

Policy.description: A Policy represents a specific policy associated with an Account and includes high-level policy information (e.g. policy number) and any children objects (e.g., coverages) associated with the policy.
Policy.name: Policy

User.description: User to attach to Ignition session. If user is set, unique `id` must be provided.
User.name: User

properties.description: User's phone number in E.164 format.

Success.description: Indicates whether the operation was performed successfully.
Success.name: Success

properties.description: Provides a reason for why the operation failed, if available.

IgnitionPostRequestBodyContentApplicatio.description: Optional object to store ephermeral information about the session, such as `reservationTime`. Will be returned in webhook events.
IgnitionPostRequestBodyContentApplicatio.name: IgnitionPostRequestBodyContentApplicationJsonSchemaMetadata

properties.description: The url you should direct the user to to link their account.
The unique ID for the ignition session.
The token required for access to the requested Account and Policy objects.
The unique id for the Account object.
List of unique ids for the Policy objects. If Ignition is configured to select a single policy (as is the default), the list will only contain 1 item.

endpoints.description: Start an Ignition session. Returns the ignitionUri to direct the user to authenticate.
endpoints.name: Start Ignition

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!

properties.description: The URI we should direct the user to after authenticating successfully.
The URI we should send updates about this session or the resulting account to.
Optional object to store ephermeral information about the session, such as `reservationTime`. Will be returned in webhook events.
The URI we should direct the user to after authenticating successfully.
The URI we should send updates about this session or the resulting account to.
Optional object to store ephermeral information about the session, such as `reservationTime`. Will be returned in webhook events.

endpoints.description:
Exchange an authorization code for an access token. Ignition returns an authCode as a query parameter at the redirectUrl upon successful completion of the Ignition flow.

Auth codes are ephemeral and expire after 10 minutes, while accessTokens do not expire.
endpoints.name: Exchange Token

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!

properties.description: The authorization code obtained after a user successfully links their account via Ignition. Returned as a query parameter at the redirectUri.
The authorization code obtained after a user successfully links their account via Ignition. Returned as a query parameter at the redirectUri.

endpoints.description: The Get Account method will return an Account object including high-level account information (e.g., name) and any children objects (e.g., Policies) associated with the Account. Please note that this method will NOT refresh the Account object.
endpoints.name: Get Account

queryParameters.description: Set to *true* if you would like to expand related entities (e.g., account, policy). Defaults to *false*.

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!

endpoints.description: The Get Policy method returns a Policy object including high-level policy information (e.g., policy number) and any children objects (e.g., Coverages) associated with the Policy. Please note that this method will NOT refresh the Policy object.
endpoints.name: Get Policy

queryParameters.description: Set to *true* if you would like to expand related entities (e.g., account, policy). Defaults to *false*.

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!

endpoints.description: The Get Carrier method returns a Carrier object that include additional details about an Axle-supported insurance carrier.
endpoints.name: Get Carrier

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!

endpoints.description: The Get Carriers method returns an array of Carrier objects.
endpoints.name: Get Carriers

headers.description: Your client ID. This will be shared with you during onboarding.
Your secret API key. This will be shared with you during onboarding and should be considered sensitive - it’s a password after all!
